history.proof: intros R H. unfold diagram. intros. shelve.

exceptions.exn: In environment A : Type X, Y : Type TX : reduction_t A X TY : reduction_t A Y F : function X Y B : relation X R : relation2 X Y H : simulation_t R x, x' : X y : Y H0 : Weak TX (T A) x x' H1 : R x y Unable to unify "simulation_t R" with "exists2 y' : Y, Weak TY (T A) y y' & R x' y'".

chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
A: Type
Y: Type
X: Type
TX: reduction_t A X
TY: reduction_t A Y
F: function X Y
B: relation X

Goal:
forall R : relation2 X Y, simulation_t R -> diagram (Weak TX (T A)) R (Weak TY (T A)) R

Premises:
simulation_t = fun R : relation2 X Y => evolve_t R R : relation2 X Y -> Prop
relation2 = fun X Y : Type => X -> Y -> Prop : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments relation2 (_ _)%type_scope
Weak : forall A X : Type, reduction_t A X -> reduction_t A X
relation = fun X : Type => relation2 X X : Type -> Type Arguments relation _%type_scope
diagram : forall X X' Y Y' : Type, relation2 X X' -> relation2 X Y -> relation2 Y Y' -> relation2 X' Y' -> Prop
T : forall A : Type, Lbl A
function = fun X Y : Type => relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments function (_ _)%type_scope
reduction_t = fun A : Type => reduction (Lbl A) : Type -> Type -> Type Arguments reduction_t (_ _)%type_scope
evolve_1 = fun (l : Lbl A) (R S : relation2 X Y) => diagram (TX l) R (Weak TY l) S : Lbl A -> relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y -> Prop
REWeak : forall A X : Type, reduction_t A X -> reduction_t A X
EWeak : forall A X : Type, reduction_t A X -> reduction_t A X
weak_refl : forall (A X : Type) (Red : reduction_t A X) (x : X), Weak Red (T A) x x
wmon_t : wmonotonic -> forall R : relation2 X Y, simulation_t R -> simulation_t (F R)
mkwmon : increasing F -> (forall R : relation2 X Y, simulation_t R -> simulation_t (F R)) -> (forall R S : relation2 X Y, simulation_t R -> simulation_t S -> evolve_a R S -> incl R S -> evolve_a (F R) (F S)) -> wmonotonic
Record wmonotonic : Prop := mkwmon { wmon_m : increasing F; wmon_t : forall R : relation2 X Y, simulation_t R -> simulation_t (F R); wmon_a : forall R S : relation2 X Y, simulation_t R -> simulation_t S -> evolve_a R S -> incl R S -> evolve_a (F R) (F S) } Arguments mkwmon _ (_ _)%function_scope
wmon_a : wmonotonic -> forall R S : relation2 X Y, simulation_t R -> simulation_t S -> evolve_a R S -> incl R S -> evolve_a (F R) (F S)
weak_tau : forall (A X : Type) (Red : reduction_t A X) (y : X) (l : Lbl A) (x z : X), Red l x y -> Weak Red (T A) y z -> Weak Red l x z
tau_weak : forall (A X : Type) (Red : reduction_t A X) (y : X) (l : Lbl A) (x z : X), Red (T A) x y -> Weak Red l y z -> Weak Red l x z
weak_taus : forall (A X : Type) (Red : reduction_t A X) (y : X) (l : Lbl A) (x z : X), Weak Red l x y -> Weak Red (T A) y z -> Weak Red l x z
taus_weak : forall (A X : Type) (Red : reduction_t A X) (y : X) (l : Lbl A) (x z : X), Weak Red (T A) x y -> Weak Red l y z -> Weak Red l x z
ctrl_t : controlled -> forall R : relation2 X Y, evolve_t R (comp (star B) R) -> simulation_t (comp (star B) R)
Record controlled : Prop := mkctrl { ctrl_t : forall R : relation2 X Y, evolve_t R (comp (star B) R) -> simulation_t (comp (star B) R); ctrl_a : forall R S : relation2 X Y, evolve_t R (comp (star B) R) -> simulation_t S -> evolve_a R S -> incl R S -> evolve_a (comp (star B) R) (comp (star B) S) } Arguments mkctrl (_ _)%function_scope
mkctrl : (forall R : relation2 X Y, evolve_t R (comp (star B) R) -> simulation_t (comp (star B) R)) -> (forall R S : relation2 X Y, evolve_t R (comp (star B) R) -> simulation_t S -> evolve_a R S -> incl R S -> evolve_a (comp (star B) R) (comp (star B) S)) -> controlled
Weak_ind : forall (A X : Type) (Red : reduction_t A X) (P : Lbl A -> X -> X -> Prop), (forall x : X, P (T A) x x) -> (forall (y : X) (l : Lbl A) (x z : X), Red (T A) x y -> Weak Red l y z -> P l y z -> P l x z) -> (forall (y : X) (a : A) (x z : X), Red (L a) x y -> Weak Red (T A) y z -> P (T A) y z -> P (L a) x z) -> forall (l : Lbl A) (x x' : X), Weak Red l x x' -> P l x x'
UIter_02 : forall (X Y : Type) (F : function X Y), increasing F -> (forall R : relation2 X Y, incl R (F R)) -> (forall R : relation2 X Y, incl (F (F R)) (F R)) -> contains (UIter F) F
diagram_plus_wf_2 : forall (X : Set) (S TX : relation X), diagram TX S (star TX) (plus S) -> well_founded (trans S) -> forall TX' : relation X, diagram TX' S (comp (star TX) TX') (plus S) -> forall (Y : Type) (R R' : relation2 X Y) (TY TY' : relation Y), diagram TX R (star TY) (comp (star S) R) -> diagram TX' R (comp (star TY) TY') (comp (star S) R') -> diagram (comp (star TX) TX') (comp (star S) R) (comp (star TY) TY') (comp (star S) R')
diagram_star_wf_1 : forall (X : Set) (S TX : relation X), local_commute TX S -> well_founded (trans (comp (plus S) (plus TX))) -> forall (Y : Type) (R : relation2 X Y) (TY : relation Y), diagram TX R (star TY) (comp (star S) R) -> diagram (star TX) (comp (star S) R) (star TY) (comp (star S) R)
evolve_t = fun R S : relation2 X Y => evolve_1 (T A) R S : relation2 X Y -> relation2 X Y -> Prop
ctrl_a : controlled -> forall R S : relation2 X Y, evolve_t R (comp (star B) R) -> simulation_t S -> evolve_a R S -> incl R S -> evolve_a (comp (star B) R) (comp (star B) S)
diagram_star_wf_2 : forall (X : Set) (S TX : relation X), local_commute TX S -> well_founded (trans (comp (plus S) (plus TX))) -> forall (Y : Type) (R : relation2 X Y) (TY : relation Y), diagram TX R (star TY) (comp (star S) R) -> forall (X' Y' : Type) (TaX : relation2 X X') (TaY : relation2 Y Y') (S' : relation2 X' X') (R' : relation2 X' Y'), diagram TaX S (comp (star TX) TaX) (star S') -> diagram TaX R (comp (star TY) TaY) (comp (star S') R') -> diagram (comp (star TX) TaX) (comp (star S) R) (comp (star TY) TaY) (comp (star S') R')
red_weak : forall (A X : Type) (Red : reduction_t A X) (l : Lbl A) (x y : X), Red l x y -> Weak Red l x y
diagram_r : forall A X Y : Type, reduction A X -> relation2 X Y -> reduction A Y -> relation2 X Y -> Prop
wexpansion1 = fun R : relation2 X Y => diagram_r TX R (REWeak TY) R : relation2 X Y -> Prop
expansion1 = fun R : relation2 X Y => diagram_r TX R (EWeak TY) R : relation2 X Y -> Prop
mon_t : monotonic -> forall R S : relation2 X Y, evolve_t R S -> incl R S -> evolve_t (F R) (F S)
mon_a : monotonic -> forall R S : relation2 X Y, evolve R S -> incl R S -> evolve_a (F R) (F S)
Record monotonic : Prop := mkmon { mon_m : increasing F; mon_t : forall R S : relation2 X Y, evolve_t R S -> incl R S -> evolve_t (F R) (F S); mon_a : forall R S : relation2 X Y, evolve R S -> incl R S -> evolve_a (F R) (F S) } Arguments mkmon _ (_ _)%function_scope
Lbl_rect : forall (A : Type) (P : Lbl A -> Type), P (T A) -> (forall a : A, P (L a)) -> forall l : Lbl A, P l
Lbl_rec : forall (A : Type) (P : Lbl A -> Set), P (T A) -> (forall a : A, P (L a)) -> forall l : Lbl A, P l
Lbl_sind : forall (A : Type) (P : Lbl A -> SProp), P (T A) -> (forall a : A, P (L a)) -> forall l : Lbl A, P l
Lbl_ind : forall (A : Type) (P : Lbl A -> Prop), P (T A) -> (forall a : A, P (L a)) -> forall l : Lbl A, P l
mkmon : increasing F -> (forall R S : relation2 X Y, evolve_t R S -> incl R S -> evolve_t (F R) (F S)) -> (forall R S : relation2 X Y, evolve R S -> incl R S -> evolve_a (F R) (F S)) -> monotonic
diagram_plus : forall (X X' : Type) (RX : relation2 X X') (R : relation X) (S : relation X'), diagram RX R RX (plus S) -> diagram RX (plus R) RX (plus S)
diagram_star : forall (X X' : Type) (RX : relation2 X X') (R : relation X) (S : relation X'), diagram RX R RX (star S) -> diagram RX (star R) RX (star S)
eeq_r : forall A X : Type, relation (reduction A X)
incl_r : forall A X : Type, relation (reduction A X)
diagram_reverse : forall (X X' Y Y' : Type) (RX : relation2 X X') (R : relation2 X Y) (RY : relation2 Y Y') (R' : relation2 X' Y'), diagram RX R RY R' -> diagram R RX R' RY
diagram_plus_wf : forall (X : Set) (S TX : relation X), diagram TX S (star TX) (plus S) -> well_founded (trans S) -> diagram (star TX) (plus S) (star TX) (plus S)
